Motorball
FEEDBACK / feedback
Leave feedback about current in-game features/functionality. How to leave your feedback: 1. Use the command ! feedback (without the space). This command only works within this channel. 2. Within the same message and on the same line, type a concise, good quality title for your feedback. You will get a DM from the bot to give more information if needed. 3. There is an upvote thresh-hold on feedback. This means that if feedback gets 5 upvotes or more, a card in our project management tool, Codecks, will be made for the Noodlecake team to see. If it does not get enough upvotes, it will not be added, so please be sure to put a lot of thought into your feedback. Leaderboards will be posted in #feedback-leaderboard with the top 10 community feedback once a week on Fridays. Being in the top 10 doesn't necessarily mean that your feedback will for sure be added into the game. Troll/joke feedback will be deleted and result in warning. Community board: https://open.codecks.io/motorball

TackyBrad 02-Jul-20 01:47 PM
Gonna add a dump here guys. 1) It's clear the game is heavily inspired by rocket league. Realize it is wildly successful and borrow more theory from it. For example: The ball to car ratio. Our cars are too big compared to the ball, it's very difficult to get on the opposite side of the ball and hit it back the other direction. Make the field wider and elongate the corner curve. One powerup should not replace another, similarly you shouldn't be able to boost starve someone (or powerup starve them) if you are already full yourself. We need better acceleration control. Varying speed shouldn't be so difficult, I'd like to see something implemented in that regard. Shockwave powerup is way overpowered. Nerf the range to about half and it will probably be fairly balanced. Overall the game feels pretty good. We might need more traction off the bat though. I'd also like to see you consider adding the ability to lose traction (like powerslide in rocket league). So our turns would be wider but more predictable, then we have the option to drift. Please also make the goal deeper. The car should be able to be farther in the goal than a scored ball to hit it out.
6

PleaseRageQuit 06-Jul-20 11:54 AM
Levelling proposal.. As the game stands, a rank 1 simply cannot beat a rank 10 because the rank 10 has received 10 ranks of stat upgrades - the rank 1 is at a glass ceiling, waiting to rank up to progress competitively. This is unavoidable, and the IAP model uses levelling and stat increasing as an incentive to purchase. However, there is a way to mitigate how significant the difference is through the application of diminishing returns to stat parameters (i.e. increasing Control from 1-2 has a bigger impact than increasing Control from 10-11). This can be done as the game currently stands, however I think there is additional value in adding many more levels to the game and increasing the stat cap. It means people level faster and increase stats faster. The impact is identical to what it would be if there was only 10 levels and a stat cap of 12, but the important difference is the user feels as though they’re making progression quicker, and have more ‘control’ over their stat distribution. An example would be the same model we have, but a level 100 cap with a stat cap of 25 where you can distribute 1 stat per level and know these stats diminish in effect the higher you go in a stat
bluetwo 06-Jul-20 12:20 PM
Perhaps the key to keeping the game competitive is to have an overall total gettable skill points that’s less than enough to allow you to max every stat at the same time. So it forces people to compromise and always have at least some weakness - Ie potentially be weaker than others on one of the stats. Then if a level-max player plays a level-max-minus-one player, they will still have a good advantage for their grind, but won’t be unbeatable on at least one of the stats if they can play to that strength. It would also be possible to couple that concept with a toggle you can use in-play to switch your stats from ‘offensive’ to say ‘defensive’. Eg you might go for higher speed, boost etc in offence/need to score mode and then when ahead switch of a higher weight/inertia car mode, more controlled/agile mode to defend the lead.

RgRdGr 16-Aug-20 07:11 PM
I find it hilarious people defending the imbalance of this game, and telling the disadvantaged player to “anticipate” and “strategize” for any possible power-up. If someone is level 8, you have such a small chance at guessing what power-up they have. And since the power-ups work very differently from each other, there’s no “anticipating” how it’s going to be used against you. These are weak points and not realistic for anyone to “get good” and defending against someone who’s just got better tools to win the game, not to mention faster at accelerating and top speed. Sure, you can play more defensively and wait for the right opportunity to strike. There are ways of mitigating some of tools used against you. But, just call it what it is. You want to have the advantage, pay up or grind it out and in a few months you’ll get close to the top and narrow the gap. But plan to be frustrated along the way with a “competitive” game that purposely suppresses the free-to-play in order to incentivize the spender.

Kay-Lynne 04-Nov-20 10:32 AM
Hey everyone! No surprise, but we're implementing a new feature/command here on this server that is already a thing on the Golf Blitz server, but figured it would be a good thing to add here too! You can now use a command to leave us your feedback. They will be added to a public board that everyone can see, including the Noodlecake team. How to leave your feedback: 1. Use the command ! feedback (without the space). This command only works within this channel. 2. Within the same message and on the same line, type a concise, good quality title for your feedback. You will get a DM from the bot to give more information if needed. 3. There is an upvote thresh-hold on feedback. This means that if feedback gets 5 upvotes or more, a card in our project management tool, Codecks, will be made for the Noodlecake team to see (this does not mean that we will for sure 100% complete this!). If it does not get enough upvotes, it will not be added, so please be sure to put a lot of thought into your feedback. To upvote, use this symbol: ✅ Leaderboards will be posted in #feedback-leaderboard with the top 10 community feedback once a week on Fridays. Being in the top 10 doesn't necessarily mean that your feedback will for sure be added into the game, but it is way more likely that we will see it and consider it. Troll/joke feedback will be deleted and will result in a warning. You can find the community board here: https://open.codecks.io/motorball (edited)
5

Wow this game is absolutely 1000x better than Rocket League. I've enjoyed the concept of rocket league, but never wanted to play i based on a few reasons. but then there's Motorball. Boom! That's what aspect was missing! Let alone just the fact that I love the game is 2D. That alone made me install the game. Cars, Soccer ball? Simple controls? Most definitely! My favorite feature being the ability to have a free placing Direction Pad. It's on separate function soley for direct. I love that it gives you the that feel as if your direction pad was a gaming mouse. The movement feels perfect. No latency, feels like a glove. Of course all games are going to go through those few glitches from here and there, but wow, I can tell this game has had a team working on it for hours and hours, being what? 3 months or so now being out? Just wanted to thank all of y'all for the hardwork, and creativity this game has! The key thing that really made this game even so much more enjoyable when the speed was not effected by level, everyone has fair chance with all skills as well. It balanced out so well. Keep it up! This game is crazy tactical. I used to play ESO back in the day, so I feel this game really complements the tactical 1v1 aspects of pvp. I feel that if this game keeps going on this steady path, other Game Modes would be interesting to think of. I'm pretty damned stoked. Thanks again!
